intro: Bobartia umbellata, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Bobartia umbellata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
